intro: Uragoga nitidula, commonly known as the slender urara, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers with five petals. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in humid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of wetland flora.
